name: Edit Suits Co.
description:
Edit Suits Co. is a London & Singapore-based menswear startup.

The company created a hassle free menswear shopping experience by selling made-to-measure garments through an innovative combination of e-commerce and physical retail.

Menswear is the fastest growing fashion segment with annual global sales surpassing USD 404 bn – Suit sales account for USD 141 bn.

Run by a team of experienced former e-commerce and finance executives (Rocket Internet / Zalora, UBS), Edit Suits Co. is uniquely positioned to capture the increasing global trend for custom options.

jobs.title: Business Developer with Entrepreneurial Mindset
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Edit Suits Co. is a young and dynamic Menswear Company founded by INSEAD grads. We’re using an innovative combination of e-commerce and physical retail to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers. We are a fast expanding company full of driven, lively and fun individuals based in London and Singapore.


The Role

We are looking for a driven business developer to assist with performance improvement and growth initiatives for our UK business. The current UK and Singapore set-up consists of 3 showrooms, and a team of 20 people, consisting of sales, operations/customer service, photography/ videography/ graphic design, as well as outsourced marketing, & IT development resources.


The responsibilities include:

•	Getting familiarised with sales and operations processes
•	Day-to-day management of sales & operations teams
•	Defining & executing people strategy (incl. hiring, performance reviews & definition of development goals for each team member)
•	Defining & streamlining processes (incl. definition of IT needs)
•	Local offline marketing & PR initiatives
•	Execution of offline marketing initiatives
•	Defining initiatives that can further accelerate growth and further improve customer experience
•	Assisting with the UK expansion beyond London


Your Profile

We are looking for a smart and highly driven individual who is as excited about a true entrepreneurial experience as we are and shows initiative, creativity, and a boundless will to get things done. Previous experience in Management Consulting or Startups is a plus. This is a full-time position and will be based out of London.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager (SEO & paid ads) - Menswear
jobs.description:
ABOUT US

Edit Suits Co. is a high-end custom menswear company that is revolutionising the way men shop for clothing. We are using an innovative combination of e-commerce and physical retail to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers.

We are looking for a talented and driven Digital Marketing / SEO Manager to join our London team and help the company to unlock the next growth phase.

JOB SCOPE

- Continuously work on the SEO of the website (on-site and off-site)
- Develop and manage paid Facebook campaigns
- Improve UX with focus on conversion rate optimisation
- Track and analyse website traffic & conversions
- Test & manage new digital marketing channels
- Identify new trends in digital marketing, evaluate new technologies and ensure the brand is at the forefront of industry developments, particularly developments in mobile marketing

REQUIREMENTS

- Deep experience with SEO
- Deep experience in digital marketing (especially Facebook advertising)
- Must be data-driven with experience with performance measurement tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, screen recording tools, AB testing tools
- Experience in drafting and sending email campaigns to segmented lists, and measuring their impact
- Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital content that engages, informs and motivates
- Good knowledge of Wordpress
- Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript is a plus

jobs.title: E-Commerce Internship in Operations
jobs.description:
Edit Suits Co. is a high-end made-to-measure menswear company that is revolutionizing the way men shop for clothing. We’re using an innovative combination of e-commerce and direct sales to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers. We're a young and dynamic team of former Rocket Internet and banking professionals, and are looking for people who "get stuff done". Edit Suits Co. launched in Singapore in March 2014, and expanded in the UK at the end of 2014.

Not interested in joining a big corporate, but looking for a fast learning experience in a fun environment?

We've got a challenge for you! Join us and be at the forefront of a fast growing start up that has presence in the UK and Singapore, and is preparing to launch in new markets. We’re looking for a hands-on intern to join our Operations team.

Your role will primarily involve:
- Frequent work in Excel and Google Sheets (you need to be familiar with those) 
- Place and monitor customer orders, speaking to international manufacturers
- Support customer services
- Assist with accounting and tracking of order metrics
- Interested in exploring other areas on top of this? No problem - show us you're motived and take ownership, and we'll have more opportunities for you!
 
Requirements:
- Only Singapore residents and student visa holders able to work full time, available mid July
- Available for min. 2 months, longer is better
- Driven and motivated
- Higher education (diploma or bachelor degree) preferred
- Familiar with Excel and Google Sheets
- Good English language skills (verbally and in writing)

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

jobs.title: E-commerce Operations Executive
jobs.description:
Edit Suits Co. is a high-end made-to-measure fashion technology company that is revolutionizing the way men shop for clothing. We’re using an innovative combination of e-commerce and direct sales to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers. We're a young and dynamic team of former Rocket Internet and banking professionals,and are looking for people who "get stuff done".

Having launched just over 2 years ago, Edit Suits Co. is now operating in London and Singapore, and will soon prepare further expansion. 

Excited about our story? Get in touch now!

Responsibilities:
We have recently completed a fund raise, and are now bringing the business to the next level. Sales in Singapore and London are growing fast, and we are looking for a hands-on Operations Manager (Singapore) to take charge of all operational and customer service aspects.

Your role will primarily involve:
- In charge of all biz dev and operational aspects, working closely with the country manager and co-founders
- Take a leading role in roll out of new systems in Singapore
- Management of customer orders and outfitter schedules
- Oversee and manage quality control of our products and customer service
- Monitor and improve operational and financial KPIs

Requirements:
- Only Singaporean citizen need to apply (we are unable to provide an S Pass or EP)
- Higher educational background (minimum Bachelor degree)
- Technical major preferred (e.g. accounting, finance, engineering)
- Driven and motivated
- Good English language skills (verbal and in writing)
- Basic programming skills (html, javascript) is a PLUS

jobs.title: Operations Executive
jobs.description:
Fast growing fashion company looking for Operations Executive.

Who are we?

Edit Suits Co. is a young and dynamic high-end made to measure Menswear Company that is revolutionising the way men shop for clothing. We’re using an innovative combination of e-commerce and physical retail to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers. We are a rapidly expanding company full of driven, lively and fun individuals based in London and Singapore.

The Role

We are growing fast and we’re looking for a motivated hands-on Operations Care Executive to join our London team. The job requires you to handle the administration of customer orders, handle customer enquiries, liaise with manufacturers and courier companies, and pro-actively solve problems. Service excellence, customer care and satisfaction is an integral part of the business and the role has a direct impact on the performance of the company.

Key Responsibilities

- Place and manage customer orders
- Drive continuous operational improvements; Identify issue areas and provide feedback to the relevant team members
- Handling customer enquiries while upholding high customer satisfaction levels- - Manage customer communication through different channels (email, phone and social)
- Manage and oversee quality control of products
- Various other operations-related tasks

Required skills for the role

- Motivation & interest in working in a startup
- Driven self-started with willingness to learn quickly
- Excellent spoken and written English (English as a first language is preferred)
- Highly professional work attitude and confident phone manners
- Excellent attention to detail and time management skills
- Good working knowledge of Google Docs and Excel
- Ability to effectively multi-task
- Able to adapt to and balance changing priorities
- Ambitious, enthusiastic and willing to go the extra mile

Working at Edit Suits Co.

We are a small and hard working team that are passionate about what we do. Our showrooms and offices are located next to London Liverpool Street Station and next to London Bond Street Station. Everyday we work on a multitude of fresh challenges. If this sounds like the perfect role for you please send us your CV.

Edit Suits Co. is a high-end custom menswear company that is revolutionising the way men shop for clothing. We are using an innovative combination of e-commerce and physical retail to sell our high-quality products and are dedicated to offering the best customer experience to our customers.

We’re looking for an experienced creative in-house graphic designer with a passion for luxury menswear to join our team in London.

Our website is our business card and we’re looking for someone that is as excited about bringing it to the next level as we are. This encompasses all aspects of our online and offline presence.

The Job:
- Working across multiple channels to produce high quality design for the website and marketing assets
- Creating weekly newsletters
- Working on parts of the desktop and mobile website to improve aesthetics and functionality
- Design for print (e.g leaflets, signboards, business cards)
- Content creation for social media (Instagram, Facebook and Twitter)
- Product photography (training will be provided)
- Retouching skills (deep-etching, high end retouching)
- Moodboards and art direction on photoshoots
- Using Wordpress to update aspects of the website
- Ensuring imagery and design is on brand and consistent
- Basic HTML/CSS and copywriting is a plus!

Must Haves:
- Minimum of 2 years experience as a graphic designer in fashion
- Experience in using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
- A good attention to detail
- Strong time management and ability to prioritise when working on multiple projects
- Fluent or native English

Please state your notice period and current salary in your cover letter, as well as your design portfolio.
